item.title: Permutive API outage
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Permutive API Outage

The Permutive API experienced a major outage, causing platform downtime between 01:36 UTC and 06:49 UTC on 5th March 2024. The outage affected Insights and Routing services, while segmentation & activation of users remained operational with degraded service. Our team is investigating the cause.

Mar 5, 09:20 UTC
Monitoring - The Permutive API suffered an outage between 01:36 UTC and 06:49 UTC on 5th March 2024. During this period, segmentation & activation of users remained operational with degraded service, but Insights and Routing were affected. All services have been restored and our team are investigating the cause.

item.title: Delays in S3 Routing (Batch) data sync
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Incident with Event Ingestion

Summary: Data from August 27th and 28th has been delayed, impacting S3 Routing v1 (Batch) product. While the underlying issue has been resolved, there are still slight delays in data syncing.

Aug 30, 15:19 UTC
Resolved - This incident has now been resolved. All past data is ingested & ingestion working properly.

Aug 30, 02:00 UTC
Update - Data from August 27th and August 28th have been ingested and will be synced as per the S3 Batch Routing sync today. There are still slight delays impacting August 29th data, meaning that today's sync may not deliver yesterdays data in full. We will continue to monitor the ingestion of the data for syncing.

Aug 29, 15:58 UTC
Monitoring - Our engineering team has resolved the underlying issue. S3 Routing v1 (Batch) data for dates August 27th and 28th have begun processing and will be received tomorrow on the 30th. We will continue to monitor the ingestion of the data for syncing tomorrow.

Aug 29, 15:57 UTC
Identified - We have identified an incident in our event ingestion over the weekend on Sunday, August 27th which has resulted in data not being delivered to customers with S3 Routing v1 (Batch) product for events occurred on August 27th & 28th.

This affects a device’s ability to retrieve data from other devices which belong to the same user, from other domains the user has browsed. Other segmentation functionality is unaffected, including segmentation based on all historical data, segmentation based on behaviour on the device, AMP segmentation and third-party and second-party data retrieval. Permutive is still able to identify a user correctly.

item.title: Permutive API partial outage
item.content:encoded:
Nov 1, 18:01 UTC
Resolved - This incident has now been resolved and full service restored for all customers. Our Engineering team are continuing to monitor.

Nov 1, 15:43 UTC
Update - The Permutive API is still experiencing a partial outage, as a result of a global issue with Google Cloud.
For all customers, we have created a workaround to allow the Permutive SDK to provide segmentation and client-side activation as normal; new events generated will be used in situ on respective user devices. While server-side integrations (TheTradeDesk, DV360, SalesForce Marketing Cloud, Adestra, SailThru) are not populating segments in partner platforms, we are collecting a backlog and expect to transfer all pending data when the Google cloud issue is resolved.

For some customers, a high proportion of events are not being collected server-side by the API, and will therefore be unavailable for future analytics. Cross device/cross-domain users will also not have their state synced across devices/domains in these instances. We will communicate specific details to those customers affected.

Resolution of the issue is dependent on Google's resolution of the Google Cloud outage, details of which can be found here: https://status.cloud.google.com/incident/compute/19008#19008004.

We will continue to monitor the situation, and provide updates via this status page.

Nov 1, 12:26 UTC
Investigating - The Permutive API is currently experiencing a partial outage, as a result of a global networking issue with Google Cloud.

For some customers, a high proportion of the events sent by the Permutive SDK will be lost, although targeting for returning users / cached segments will remain unaffected.
We are communicating to those customers who are impacted, and we will continue to provide updates via this status page.

Details about the Google Cloud outage can be found here: https://status.cloud.google.com/incident/compute/19008#19008004.
